title: Lecturer Below the Bar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Limerick
Interview Descriptions: Overall, very smooth interview. Very friendly interaction with the Head of the Department/School and other members of the interview panel. Online interview but the panel was very accommodating during some technical issues.
Interview Questions: Long term career goals, How to address diversity and inclusiveness

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Limerick
Interview Descriptions: Engaging, the interviewers showed genuine interest in the interviewee. The former introduced themselves, and asked the interviewee to do same.  Following formal introductions, the interview process was then described before asking the interview questions.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work as a research assistant?

Asked about prior experiences conducting research

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Overall it was a very friendly and fun experience. Both the professors who interviewed me were very cool. General questions about my knowledge of the project, and about my experience on previous jobs and projects. Also, they asked me general questions about cooperation, difficulties with previous jobs etc.
Interview Questions: Was there any conflict at your previous job? How you manage to solve it?

title: Professor of History Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Kept to time, good questions, and interested in the answers. The staff panel had few questions, however. The interviewers did not read publications in advance of the interview. All in all, a serious interview.
Interview Questions: How would you contribute to the research culture?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The reviewers were familiar with my CV and showed interest in learning more about my background and experience with research projects. Considering how friendly atmosphere they created while professionally performing all-time, I think it was an excellent experience for me overall.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with managing a research project plan.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I did the interview and got the results in two weeks time. It runs by the head of Dep and two other members and a member from HR. It took about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Q: What is your teaching style?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Limerick in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview for this job position went very smooth. The panel appeared friendly, interested in a candidate. The interview questions very task focused and tested the skills you applied at the previous job.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for this job?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very concise, to the point. At no point was I unaware of what was going on, the course leaders are very approachable and can answer all questions. Nothing difficult was asked of me.
Interview Questions: How will your undergraduate degree help you in teaching?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
A 10 min presentation first on a topic provided that is relevant to the job.
Then a quick run through the cv/application. 
Followed by questions ranging from research funding experience to teaching skills.
Interview was approximately 50 minutes.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about the paper you are most proud of and why?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: BY PHONE asking about my background and my skills and how this fit the position it was not so hard. They asked about my scientific publucations , my master thesis and my Phd subjects. That's all

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Limerick in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was mainly about my publications and skills. About dealing with IP. Dealing with teamwork group. How I deal with one problem in computational problems. How I can define the stability issues
Interview Questions: ask about my best publication to explain:

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line and I was asked for a presencial interview 2 weeks later at the University of Limerick. They covered all travel costs. The selection process included an presentation and a formal interview with department members, an external and the dean of the college.
Interview Questions:
They want a presentation about me and how I would collaborate to the department.
Questions were pretty much standard, mostly about:
My teaching style
Publication Plans
Research experience

title: Doktorand Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Das Vorstellungsgespraech life ueber Skype ab, wie es in akademischen Jobs in der Regel ist. (Telefoninterview) Es wurde einiges zum Projekt besprochen und meine Erfahrungen im Fachgebiet getestet. Insgesamt sehr entspanntest interview.
Interview Questions: Saemtliche fragen zum Fachbereich und verstaendnisfragen zum Projekt

title: Technical Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, a few of the normal interview questions. Was interviewed by two line managers who were very friendly. Started off with a general conversation about my background and where I came from followed by questions regarding my experience in my chosen field. Interview process lasted about 40 minutes in total. Received the job offer on the following day and started work a week later.
Interview Questions: About my previous work experience mainly

title: Postgraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, followed by  a visit to UL to give a seminar and to talk to the employer.
Interview Questions: Define a research statement related to the project

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Limerick (Limerick, Limerick) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I have made it online via video conferencing and it was limited to 15 minutes, 7 minutes presentations and 7 minutes discussion. the oanel consisted of 4 people covering various aspects incluing research, team work, vision, projects management, etc. The roles of the interviewers were clearly defined and i was given instructions beforehand on how it is going to be. After the interview I was not selcted directly but they called me few months later to offer another job with similar specification but different dureation.. that was nice of them. In general it was professional and the HR always answered my questions in timely fashion
Interview Questions: the plan for the future, the most siginificant publication, why did you choose this job, how would you integrate, etc.
